sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Work Life Balance
posts.content:
Balancing family and work can be tough to manage. Three Arkansas cities make it a little easier though, evidenced by their top 10 ranking for the best cities for working parents in the U.S.

  • The big three: Fayetteville landed at No. 7 in SmartAsset's study best place to life as a working parent. The cities were graded on ten metrics, and Fayetteville stood out in half of the topics assessed.
  • Splitting hairs: Fayetteville ranked lower than the other two Arkansas cities largely due to its higher housing costs; however, it had lower unemployment than the other two. Jonesboro and Conway were the other two Arkansas cities at No. 4 and No. 5.

Find out more about the top cities for working parents and the metrics behind the ranking, HERE.

posts.title: Joblessness Declining in NWA
posts.content:
This time last year, our lives and economy looked a bit different, but things are beginning to look up, especially in the jobs department. There were 61k more jobs this year in Arkansas compared to May 2020.

  • 9.1%: The job gain from May 2020 in Northwest Arkansas. This was the biggest jump of any metro area in the state. As a result, in May 2021, the region's jobless rate was only at 3.2%.
  • More numbers: Only half of the people unemployed in May of 2020 are still in that category at only 9k, with the region's workforce surpassing 295k.

Read more about the positive news HERE - this is a trend we want to keep up!

posts.title: Too Easy
posts.content:
In today's world, we can get just about anything we want within two days without ever leaving the couch. What we've been missing is an easy way to get local products delivered. Rejoicy fixes this.

  • One for all: Rejoicy is the digital home to 25 businesses in NWA, creating a marketplace that makes it easy for customers to shop from a variety of stores and checkout all in one place.
  • All for one: The platform is a win for everyone in NWA and creates another avenue for consumers to discover businesses and support them - locals helping locals!
  • Carry-out or delivery? Yes, you read that right, Rejoicy will deliver local products straight to your doorstep. You can also pick them up at designated pickup spots.

Begin shopping Rejoicy's marketplace HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's one of the biggest weekends of the summer, and NWA is doing it right for America's birthday.

  • "Berry" fun times: Spaceberry Music Festival is happening in Eureka Springs this weekend.
  • Gully Park concert: The local, neighborhood concert is rescheduled for tonight in east Fayetteville.
  • Lighting the sky: There is a long list of fireworks shows happening around the region that you can find here and here.
  • WOZ: Women of OZ monthly flagship ride is this Saturday in downtown Bentonville.
  • First Friday: Bentonville's monthly downtown First Friday event is tonight.
  • Live music: NWA has plenty of opportunities for you to experience live music over the holiday weekend.
  • New works: Check out the Momentary and Crystal Bridges new exhibits on display starting this weekend.
  • Farmers markets: And finally, all the farmers markets will be in full swing this weekend. Located at your city's downtown square.

Enjoy the weekend, and we will see you TUESDAY.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Jobs that were posted to our community Job Board recently:

  • The Ledger is looking to fill a Community Lead role at this amazing co-working space coming to Bentonville.
  • My Village Pediatric in Bentonville is looking to hire a Dental Assistant.
  • Preacher's Son, the new restaurant in Bentonville, is in search of a Line Cook.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here for FREE, and we might feature it next week!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Calling all Entrepreneurs: Walmart hosted an Open Call on Wednesday for over 900 small and medium-sized businesses who want to get their products on Walmart shelves.
  • Gaining Clout: Austin-based magazine Austin Travels came to Bentonville this month and had some great things to say about the Mountain Bike Capital of the World.
  • Well deserved: Connie Edmonston is retiring after 35 years with Fayetteville Parks and Rec.
  • Work with us: NWA Daily wants to feature your business! Check out the advertising options on our website.
